title: 2691 Green St.
Reason(s) for removal: Removal application permit 788363. Thin canopy. Poor condition. Low vigor. With on replacement. Two trees cannot fit given minimum required distanes to utility infrastructure.

title: 380 Market Street
Reason(s) for removal: Removal permit for construction (785615); construction of all new canopy entrances along Market Street Bart stations as a part of the BART Market Street Canopies Project; no replacements will be planted (https://www.bart.gov/about/planning/sfentrances). Assessed value or standard In-lieu fee (greater of the two vqalues) will be collected if tree is not replaced.

title: 375 Stonecrest Drive
Reason(s) for removal: Has root decay on tension side or opposite side of lean, high likelihood of failure; will be replaced

title: 535 Laidley St.
Reason(s) for removal: Property owner contacted BUF due to multiple dropped branches. Inspector findings: many dead branches. Decay at main branch union. Replacement dependent on underground utilities.

title: 3757 21st St.
Reason(s) for removal: Cormybia ficifolia- Removal associated with a building remodel and new garage, Permit # 788337. The tree is in poor condition. Owner has committed to plant a large stature species, 36 in. box replacement.

title: 39 Princeton Street
Reason(s) for removal: Root pruning required to fix driveway and sidewalk will remove too much root mass; property owner is committed to planting and watering replacement tree

title: 222 Winfield Street
Reason(s) for removal: Permit # 788139. Significant tree in private property. Advanced decay at base of tree and leaning towards home. Tree has outgrown confined planting space, and may be cracking retaining wall. No replacement.

title: 1056 Carolina St.
Reason(s) for removal: Permit # 788351. Home owners have produced bills from two previous sewer repairs siting tree roots as the causal agent. Significant tree growing directly over sewer, gas, and water utilities. No replacement.

title: 900X Carolina Street (in median)
Reason(s) for removal: Removal permit for construction (788327); improvement of Carolina Green Space’s “Skyline Terrace” funded by Community Challenge Grants. Trees will be replaced 1:1

title: 648 Peru Avenue (Peru Avenue Stairway)
Reason(s) for removal: Friends of Peru Avenue community organization will replace trees along with the installation of landscaping funded by Community Challenge Grants. Trees will be replaced 1:1

title: Clarendon Ave. and Dellbrook Ave.
district: Tree Removals by Other City Agencies
